questions.question: In a given population, 4050 births were recorded over a period of 1 year. Among these, 50 were stillbirths, 50 died in the 1st week of life and 150 died within 8-28 days of life. What is the neonatal mortality rate of this population?
questions.explanation: The neonatal mortality rate (NMR) of the given population is 50 per 1000 live births. Neonatal mortality rate = No. of deaths of neonates < 28 days within a year x 1000 / Total live births in the same year. In this population, there were 4000 live births (no. of total births - no. of stillbirths). NMR = (50+150) x 1000/4000 = 200/4000 = 50.

questions.question: A juvenile delinquent was sentenced by the court to be placed in a center under the care of a doctor and psychiatrist. Which of the following fulfills this requirement?
questions.explanation: A remand home is an establishment where children are placed under the care of a doctor, psychiatrist, and other trained personnel. An orphanage or shelter home is an institution where children who have no home or parents, or for some reason can't be cared for, are placed. Foster homes are arrangements where a family or a couple takes care of a child on a temporary basis. Borstal is a place that falls between a certified institution and a prison. It is where boys over 16 years who have misbehaved or are too difficult to handle are sent.

questions.question: A 68-year-old man visits your outpatient clinic for a routine follow-up. Which of the following protocols would you use to assess his health literacy?
questions.explanation:
The SPEAK protocol is used to assess health literacy in the geriatric population in a clinical setting. Health literacy is defined as the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information needed to make appropriate health decisions. The SPEAK protocol provides a simple framework that healthcare providers can use to assess literacy. SPEAK stands for: 
      • S - Speech
      • P - Perception
      • E - Education
      • A - Access
      • K - Knowledge
   Option A: The GATHER approach is mainly used for counseling (usually, family planning and reproductive counseling) to help people make decisions about health. It stands for: 
      • G - Greet
      • A - Ask
      • T - Tell
      • H - Help
      • E - Explain
      • R - Return
   Option C: The SPIKES protocol is used to convey distressing information and break bad news in an organized manner to patients and families. It stands for: 
      • S - Setting
      • P - Perception
      • I - Invitation or information
      • K - Knowledge
      • E - Empathy
      • S - Summarizing or strategizing
   Option D: The S-BAR technique is used for prompt and appropriate communication among healthcare workers in hospital settings. It stands for: 
      • S - Situation
      • B - Background
      • A - Assessment
      • R - Recommendation
